page.title: 01Macclesfield Forest Cheshire
page.content:
LOCATION
The Western edge of this block is 5 km to the East of the market town of Macclesfield and the Eastern edge is 8 km from the spa town of Buxton. The area varies from approximately 335 metres to 518 metres plus above sea level, being on the edge of the Peak National Park with the A537 running centrally through it. The landscape is open moorland for the most part with a small amount of afforestation in the South West corner. The area is sparsely populated with farms and homesteads. Land use is mainly sheep farming.
